sys_update_xml.name: sn_aia_agent_d7300cd208d032107f44a3e5c88ef0d3
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_agent"><sn_aia_agent action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Analyzes the financial impact of delivery disruptions and creates incident tracking.</description><instructions>First, perform Financial Impact Analysis. Second, create Delayed Delivery incident. Third, update the Delivery Delay record with the calculated impact.
1. Pull the Delayed Delivery details of the Route (Customer ID, Proposed Routes) and store this information in memory.
2. Use the Customer ID value of the Delayed Delivery to Locate the Supply Agreement for the Customer. Store the numerical value Customer's Delivery Window Hours and numerical value for Stockout Penalty Rate in memory.
FINANCIAL ANALYSIS INSTRUCTIONS 3.1 There are multiple options in the proposed routes. Store the numerical value of each ETA Minutes in memory. 3.2 Run the Financial Impact Calculation tool separately for EACH of the delivery's proposed route option values. There will be a unique calculation for each of the ETA minutes.
4. Return the Calculation for each proposed route combined in **USD with $** in the output format "Alternative Route Option 1 Calculated Impact: , Alternative Route Option 2 Calculated Impact: " with a line break after each option. NOTE: IF THE CALCULATED IMPACT IS A NEGATIVE NUMBER, RETURN $0.00. This is the Calculated Impact. 4.1 Store the Calculated Impact in memory.
Use the Route ID, Customer Name, Problem Description, and Calculated Impact stored in memory to create the Delayed Delivery Incident record. In the Incident Description, insert a line break between {{problem_description}} and {{calculated_impact}}. Store the created Incident's Sys ID in memory.
Update the Delivery Delay record that matches the user provided Route ID with the Calculated Impact and the Incident Sys ID.</instructions><internal_name>global.x_snc_pepsico_de_0.Delivery Delay Financial Analyzer</internal_name><name>Delivery Delay Financial Analyzer</name><proficiency>- The agent is capable of using the Route ID to perform a financial impact calculation for each proposed route when a delivery is delayed. It then creates an incident record and updates the status of the Delivery Record to 'CALCULATED'. - The agent can pull the Delayed Delivery details of the Route, including Customer ID and Proposed Routes, and store this information in memory for further processing. - The agent uses the 'Locate Supply Agreement' tool to find the Supply Agreement record for the customer using the Customer ID from the Delivery Delay record. It stores the Customer's Delivery Window Hours and Stockout Penalty Rate in memory. - The agent is capable of storing the numerical value of each ETA Minutes for the proposed routes in memory and running the Financial Impact Calculation tool separately for each route option. It ensures a unique calculation for each ETA. - The agent returns the financial impact calculation for each proposed route in USD, formatted as 'Alternative Route Option 1 Calculated Impact: , Alternative Route Option 2 Calculated Impact: ', with a line break after each option. Negative impacts are returned as $0.00. - The agent uses the Route ID, Customer Name, Problem Description, and Calculated Impact stored in memory to create a Delayed Delivery Incident record. It inserts a line break in the Incident Description and stores the created Incident's Sys ID in memory. - The agent updates the Delivery Delay record that matches the user-provided Route ID with the Calculated Impact and the Incident Sys ID, completing the process of handling a delayed delivery.</proficiency><record_type>custom</record_type><role>This agent's job is to use the Route ID to perform a financial impact calculation for each proposed route when a delivery is delayed. Then create an incident record, finally update the status of Delivery Record to "CALCULATED".</role><run_as/><strategy display_value="ReAct">f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74</strategy><sys_class_name>sn_aia_agent</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-10-02 03:35:04</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>d7300cd208d032107f44a3e5c88ef0d3</sys_id><sys_mod_count>388</sys_mod_count><sys_name>Delivery Delay Financial Analyzer</sys_name><sys_package display_value=" PepsiCo Deliveries" source="x_snc_pepsico_de_0">f854756dd19032107f445553c70cd976</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value=" PepsiCo Deliveries">f854756dd19032107f445553c70cd976</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_agent_d7300cd208d032107f44a3e5c88ef0d3</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-10-08 01:34:26</sys_updated_on></sn_aia_agent></record_update>

sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_usecase"><sn_aia_usecase action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><base_plan>When the trigger Pending_Delivery_Delay is activated, retrieve the Route ID from the record. You will run the Delivery Delay Financial Analyzer and then run the Route Decision Agent to select the most optimal alternative route.
You are triggered by Pending_Delivery_Delay. You will retrieve the Route ID from the record. Store this Route ID in memory to run both Agents. Use the tools as exactly as directed. Pass only numerical values of the inputs of the Financial Impact Tool. Do not pass in text. Only pass in numbers.
1. Use Financial Analyzer to find the calculated impact of delivery delay. 2. Use the Route Decision Agent to choose the most optimal route</base_plan><description>This use case is automatically triggered immediately when vendors relay a Delayed Delivery. This multi-agent workflow runs a cost analysis on alternative routes, makes a determination for which alternative route is best suited for PepsiCo business needs, then communicates the chosen route to external vendors to reroute PepsiCo deliveries without manual intervention.</description><execution_mode>copilot</execution_mode><internal_name>global.x_snc_pepsico_de_0.Analyze Delivery Delays</internal_name><name>Analyze Delivery Delays</name><record_type>custom</record_type><sys_class_name>sn_aia_usecase</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-10-02 02:58:56</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>890d7170a83722107f447c94bcf191ad</sys_id><sys_mod_count>15</sys_mod_count><sys_name>Analyze Delivery Delays</sys_name><sys_package display_value=" PepsiCo Deliveries" source="x_snc_pepsico_de_0">f854756dd19032107f445553c70cd976</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value=" PepsiCo Deliveries">f854756dd19032107f445553c70cd976</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_usecase_890d7170a83722107f447c94bcf191ad</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-10-08 03:51:45</sys_updated_on><team display_value="Analyze Delivery Delays">9a0fbb4a089032107f44a3e5c88ef05f</team><version>v1</version></sn_aia_usecase></record_update>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_execution_task"><sn_aia_execution_task action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Delivery Delay Financial Analyzer</description><execution_plan display_value="Created 2025-10-08 03:52:26">04d447c8c86472107f448d8884de34fa</execution_plan><metadata>{"agentDetails":{"name":"Delivery Delay Financial Analyzer","role":"This agent's job is to use the Route ID to perform a financial impact calculation for each proposed route when a delivery is delayed. Then create an incident record, finally update the status of Delivery Record to "CALCULATED".","background":"First, perform Financial Impact Analysis.
Second, create Delayed Delivery incident.
Third, update the Delivery Delay record with the calculated impact.

1. Pull the Delayed Delivery details of the Route (Customer ID, Proposed Routes) and store this information in memory.

2. Use the Customer ID value of the Delayed Delivery to Locate the Supply Agreement for the Customer. Store the numerical value Customer's Delivery Window Hours and numerical value for Stockout Penalty Rate in memory.

FINANCIAL ANALYSIS INSTRUCTIONS
3.1 There are multiple options in the proposed routes. Store the numerical value of each ETA Minutes in memory. 
3.2 Run the Financial Impact Calculation tool separately for EACH of the delivery's proposed route option values. There will be a unique calculation for each of the ETA minutes.

4. Return the Calculation for each proposed route combined in **USD with $** in the output format "Alternative Route Option 1 Calculated Impact: , Alternative Route Option 2 Calculated Impact: " with a line break after each option. NOTE: IF THE CALCULATED IMPACT IS A NEGATIVE NUMBER, RETURN $0.00. This is the Calculated Impact. 
4.1 Store the Calculated Impact in memory. 

Use the Route ID, Customer Name, Problem Description, and Calculated Impact stored in memory to create the Delayed Delivery Incident record. In the Incident Description, insert a line break between {{problem_description}} and {{calculated_impact}}. Store the created Incident's Sys ID in memory.

Update the Delivery Delay record that matches the user provided Route ID with the Calculated Impact and the Incident Sys ID.","sys_id":"d7300cd208d032107f44a3e5c88ef0d3","strategy":"f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74"},"task":"Use the Route ID to perform a financial impact calculation for each proposed route when a delivery is delayed. Create an incident record and update the status of the Delivery Record to 'CALCULATED'.","strategyTopic":"AIA-ReAct"}</metadata><order>200</order><output>{"scratchpad":[{"Thought":"The mission is to use the Route ID to perform a financial impact calculation for each proposed route when a delivery is delayed. sys_update_xml.name: sn_aia_agent_62f4ece7641072107f44682690bd8a86
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_agent"><sn_aia_agent action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Selects optimal routes and coordinate external execution.</description><instructions>You will be provided with the Route ID.
1. Use the provided Route ID to Pull Delivery Delay Details.
2. Analyze the route options and select an option_id that optimizes the corresponding distance_miles and calculated_impact. Store the **entire route object** (including option_id, route_number, distance_miles, and eta_minutes) in your memory as Decision, not just the option_id string. Decision must be a structured JSON object, not plain text.
3. Update Delivery Delay Record of Route ID with the entire Decision JSON object,
4. Update the associated Incident record's Urgency based on financial severity. Use the following guidelines to set Urgency: - If the option costs LESS than $500, then set Urgency to 3- Low. - If the option costs BETWEEN $501-$1000, then set Urgency to 2- Medium. - If the option costs MORE than $1000, then set Urgency to 1- High.
5. Retrieve Webhook Value. You will use this data to trigger the webhook.
6. Trigger n8n webhook with the Route ID and Retrieved Webhook Value.
PAUSE FLOW FOR 8 SECONDS.
7. Run the Dispatched Status Checker on the Route ID. Store the Dispatched Status Checker's Chosen Option.
8. Use the Incident Resolver with the Incident Sys Id and the Dispatched Status Checker's Chosen Option field.</instructions><internal_name>global.x_snc_pepsico_de_0.Route Decision Agent</internal_name><name>Route Decision Agent</name><proficiency>- The AGENT is capable of analyzing route options to determine the most efficient path, considering both cost and time, and updating the Delivery Record and Incident priority accordingly. - The AGENT can retrieve delivery delay details using the provided Route ID, which is essential for understanding the current status and potential issues with the delivery. - The AGENT can evaluate multiple route options and select the one that optimizes distance and calculated impact, storing this decision as a structured JSON object for further use. - The AGENT is capable of updating the Delivery Delay Record with the entire Decision JSON object, ensuring that all relevant details of the chosen route are recorded. - The AGENT can assess the financial impact of the chosen route option and update the associated Incident record's Urgency level accordingly, using predefined cost thresholds. - The AGENT can retrieve the Webhook Value using the 'Retrieve Webhook Value' tool, which is necessary for triggering the webhook with the Route ID. - The AGENT can trigger an n8n webhook using the Route ID and the retrieved Webhook Value, facilitating communication with external systems. - The AGENT can pause the flow for 8 seconds after triggering the webhook, allowing time for the webhook to process before continuing with further actions. - The AGENT can run the Dispatched Status Checker on the Route ID to verify the status of the chosen route option, ensuring that the decision is being executed as planned. - The AGENT can use the Incident Resolver with the Incident Sys Id and the Dispatched Status Checker's Chosen Option to finalize the resolution of the incident, ensuring that all actions are completed.</proficiency><record_type>custom</record_type><role>You use the Route ID to find the optimal route based on cost and time constraint, then update the Delivery Record, then update the incident's priority, then communicate the decision to via web hook.</role><run_as/><strategy display_value="ReAct">f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74</strategy><sys_class_name>sn_aia_agent</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-10-06 03:28:45</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>62f4ece7641072107f44682690bd8a86</sys_id><sys_mod_count>188</sys_mod_count><sys_name>Route Decision Agent</sys_name><sys_package display_value=" PepsiCo Deliveries" source="x_snc_pepsico_de_0">f854756dd19032107f445553c70cd976</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value=" PepsiCo Deliveries">f854756dd19032107f445553c70cd976</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_agent_62f4ece7641072107f44682690bd8a86</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-10-07 23:44:04</sys_updated_on></sn_aia_agent></record_update>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_execution_task"><sn_aia_execution_task action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Route Decision Agent</description><execution_plan display_value="Created 2025-10-08 03:52:26">04d447c8c86472107f448d8884de34fa</execution_plan><metadata>{"agentDetails":{"name":"Route Decision Agent","role":"You use the Route ID to find the optimal route based on cost and time constraint, then update the Delivery Record, then update the incident's priority, then communicate the decision to via web hook.","background":"You will be provided with the Route ID.


1. Use the provided Route ID to Pull Delivery Delay Details.

2. Analyze the route options and select an option_id that optimizes the corresponding distance_miles and calculated_impact. Store the **entire route object** (including option_id, route_number, distance_miles, and eta_minutes) in your memory as Decision, not just the option_id string.
Decision must be a structured JSON object, not plain text.

3. Update Delivery Delay Record of Route ID with the entire Decision JSON object, 

4. Update the associated Incident record's Urgency based on financial severity. Use the following guidelines to set Urgency:
- If the option costs LESS than $500, then set Urgency to 3- Low.
- If the option costs BETWEEN $501-$1000, then set Urgency to 2- Medium.
- If the option costs MORE than $1000, then set Urgency to 1- High.

5. Retrieve Webhook Value. You will use this data to trigger the webhook.

6. Trigger n8n webhook with the Route ID and Retrieved Webhook Value.

PAUSE FLOW FOR 8 SECONDS. 

7. Run the Dispatched Status Checker on the Route ID. Store the Dispatched Status Checker's Chosen Option.

8. Use the Incident Resolver with the Incident Sys Id and the Dispatched Status Checker's Chosen Option field.","sys_id":"62f4ece7641072107f44682690bd8a86","strategy":"f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74"},"task":"Analyze route options to determine the most efficient path, considering both cost and time.
